factText: Life threatening impacts from Florence, including extreme storm surge, catastrophic and possibly historic flooding rains, and damaging winds continue. HURRICANE FLORENCE: On its current track, Florence could cause sustained winds and storm surges in the Norfolk area, so the U.S. Navy is preparing. ..NOAA HURRICANE HUNTER FINDS FLORENCE A LITTLE STRONGER.. ..FLORENCE EXPECTED TO BECOME A HURRICANE AGAIN TONIGHT OR EARLY SUNDAY..  Tropical Storm Florence is centered at 5 p.m. AST over the Atl
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_Hurricane_Has a storm surge been observed during {event}?

factText: Because of you, God's Pit Crew is watching and waiting to help Hurricane Florence storm victims. N2N is closely monitoring hurricane Florence. If you are interested in helping N2N and other relief efforts, please contact the office at 843-839-0702 and we will add you to the list!. The Salvation Army is urging everyone to prepare now as the National Hurricane Center forecasts Florence will be a major hurricane.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_general_What volunteer efforts are currently active for {event}?

factText: Tropical Storm Florence continues westward with 65 mph maximum sustained winds. Tropical storm Florence expected to become a major category 4 hurricane again with 130mph winds by Wednesday. Could be a formidable threat to the Carolinas later next week. The 5pm update clocks Tropical Storm Florence's winds at 70mph. Still looks like we could be looking at a major hurricane making landfall on the Carolina coast by the end of next week.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_Hurricane_What is the maximum sustained wind speed recorded for {event}?

factText: RALEIGH, N.C. (WNCN/AP) - North Carolina's governor declared a State of Emergency on Friday evening as Hurricane Florence continues to churn in the Atlantic Ocean. As Hurricane Florence is projected to hit the East Coast next week, Gov. Roy Cooper has issued emergency orders. North Carolina and South Carolina both are now under a State of Emergency due to the arrival of Hurricane Florence
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q014

factText: HURRICANE Florence has weakened to a tropical storm but forecasters expect the system to strengthen towards a Category 4 hurricane next week. The latest forecast track for Tropical Storm #Florence brings the storm close to the Carolinas by Wednesday as a Category 4 hurricane. HURRICANE THREAT: Tropical Storm Florence is forecast to strengthen into a Category 4 hurricane by tomorrow.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_Hurricane_What is the category of the hurricane impacting {event}?

factText: Tropical Storm Florence Advisory Number 35 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL AL062018 1100 PM AST Fri Sep 07 2018 ..FLORENCE FORECAST TO RESTRENGTHEN LATER THIS WEEKEND.. SUMMARY OF 1100 PM AST. 11 AM #FLORENCE.. Hilton Head Island, SC to Morehead City, NC is now in the cone. Florence is expected to regain Hurricane strength tonight and forecast to reach category 4 by Tuesday.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_Hurricane_What is the expected recovery time for communities affected by {event}?

factText: CANCELLED:  UPDATE DUE TO HURRICANE FLORENCE - Due to the closure of the campus of Pitt Community College on Monday, September 17th, this event has been canceled.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q022

factText: Flood watches are now in place for parts of the Finger Lakes in anticipation of a prolonged heavy rain event Sunday night through Monday. Rain Continues Into Tonight With Lots of Clouds More Rain Later Tomorrow into Monday Flood Watch Western NJ Counties & Much of Pennsylvania New Moon Coastal Flooding Possble Next Several Days L…. The area has received as much as 10 to 20 inches over the last 24 hours, and additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 FEET are possible through the weekend.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q043

factText: HURRICANE FLORENCE RPOEM ADVISORY #5: Rochelle Park Emergency Management Preparation efforts are continuing in advance of the potential impact Hurricane Florence may have on the East Coast and our are. With hurricane Florence churning away in the Atlantic and the path still uncertain we are urging citizens to start preparing for possible bad weather next weekend by making sure you have plenty of bas
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_general_What actions are being taken by law enforcement to ensure safety during {event}?

factText: We don’t know yet if Hurricane Florence is going to require evacuation s for our area, but now is a good time to make sure you know what evacuation zone you’re in. ***IMPORTANT NOTICE*** If an evacuation is order for Hurricane Florence ALL evacuations will take place going south off the beach and thru Duck. We got the official notification for evacuating South Caroline for #HurricaneFlorence .
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_Hurricane_What areas were under mandatory evacuation for {event}?

factText: With Tropical Storm Florence forecast to strengthen as it heads toward the East Coast, Gov. Roy Cooper declared a State of Emergency and waived transportation rules to help farmers harvest and transpo
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_general_How is public transportation affected by {event}?

factText: *** NOAA NWS Hurricane Center is pretty much going with Hurricane (By landfall arrival), Florence making landfall somewhere along SE Coast. We are closely following the path of Hurricane Florence, which is expected to make landfall late next week. It appears with increasing confidence that Hurricane Florence will make landfall on the East Coast mid to late next week, however it is still too early to be certain where and what areas will be most
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-Hurricane-q004

factText: THE STORM PREDICTION CENTER HAS HIGHLIGHTED FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT A MARGINAL RISK FOR THESE REGIONS. The National Hurricane Center is issuing advisories on TS Florence, TS Helene, and TD Nine. The National Hurricane Center has issued its first official warning on the next tropical storm moving across the Atlantic Ocean. It’s the tropical. Hurricane season is rapidly escalating. NHC issuing advisories for the Atlantic on TS Florence, TS Helene and TD Nine https://www.nhc.noaa.gov
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q032

factText: Former Hurricane Florence is expected to gain speed this weekend, which means the East Coast will begin to see effects in the form of dangerous rip currents and surf this weekend, forecasters say.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_Hurricane_Are there reports of looting or crime during {event}?

factText: The storm is predicted to become a major hurricane that will threaten portions of the East Coast between Wednesday and Friday. Florence, a tropical storm now, is expected to be a major hurricane once again by Monday. The forecast cone for day 5 now includes coastal areas of the Carolinas. The storm is predicted to re-intensify to a Category 3 hurricane by Monday and odds have increased that it will have direct effects on the East Coast starting between Wednesday and Friday next week
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q015

factText: CARTA’s Role During a Hurricane: What to Expect  If a mandatory evacuation has been called for, expect CARTA services to be suspended within 24-48 hours in order to assist with evacuation efforts.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q030

factText: In addition to the emergency circulator, as conditions allow during the evacuation, CARTA will:  Transport those with mobility impairments (disabilities) to an appropriate shelter. You need transportation to the nearest shelter during a voluntary or mandatory evacuation. Also until 6 p.m. and as conditions allow on Wednesday during the evacuation, CARTA will:  Transport those with mobility impairments (disabilities) to an appropriate shelter.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_general_Where can displaced people find emergency housing?

factText: ACTIVE ATLANTIC: We're monitoring Tropical Storm Florence as it approaches the southeast. Make sure that you are monitoring Tropical Storm Florence. She is forecasted to become a major hurricane. It is VERY important that you are prepared for this storm!!!. #Florence is becoming better organized and forecast to restrengthen to a hurricane tonight.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_general_How are international organizations responding to {event}?

factText: BREAKING | South Carolina is getting its resources ready for Florence, which is expected to become a major hurricane before it comes close to the U.S.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_general_Are hospitals and medical facilities operational after {event}?

factText: TROPICAL STORM FLORENCE UPDATE with potential Wednesday landfall: Governor Henry McMaster has issued an executive order declaring a state of emergency and, along with the S.C. Emergency Management Div. Limited emergency evacuation services will resume on Thursday, Sept. 13, at Charleston County’s direction.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_general_Are evacuation orders still in place or have they been lifted?

factText: As of now we are planning to shut down our facility starting Wednesday September 12th due to the up coming Hurricane Florence.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q028

factText: Tropical storm Florence might be getting stronger! Make sure you are prepared with emergency contacts and hurricane kit. Charleston County’s Emergency Management Department (EMD) is calling on citizens to make preparations now for the potential impacts of Florence.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_general_What emergency numbers should people call for help during {event}?

factText: Weather News.. Tropical Storm Florence expected to strengthen into hurricane soon (via NBC) #3weather. Florence could become a major hurricane by Monday, according to the National Hurricane Center. NEW: Florence is forecast to become a major hurricane (again) and is on a crash course with the Carolinas. Meteorologist Donnie Cox is tracking the latest on Tropical Storm Florence. Still projected to move toward the Carolina's as a major hurricane.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_general_What news outlets are reporting on {event} and what are they saying?

factText: Officials say Tropical Storm Florence continues to approach the U.S. East Coast and swells generated by the storm are likely to cause life-threatening surf and rip current conditions. Florence, the first major hurricane of the season, weakened to a tropical storm Thursday night. It is expected to reintensify during the weekend.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_general_What misinformation or false reports are spreading about {event}?

factText: Virginia joins North Carolina and South Carolina in declaring a state of emergency ahead of Tropical Storm (soon to… https://t.co/lUioeJop7R. informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q025

factText: TRACKING HURRICANE FLORENCE: Though too early to tell the exact path of the storm, Coastal Communities are already preparing. City Emergency Management is working closely with state and regional officials to monitor the storm’s track and coordinate preparation efforts. Begin preparations NOW, TS Florence is expected to intensify to a MAJOR hurricane before nearing the US Southeast Coast mid/late week.
